en:
On Sunday 16th October,2022, for our last performance in Rumphi we went to the village of Bowe, where we received a warm welcome from local villagers. 
The teachers in each local village were essential in helping us ask the audiences questions about the activities, which will be important for our research. There was a great football match between Bowe vs Betere and the local netball teams played really well too.
This, being our last performance in Rumphi, was very successful and we had lots of good questions about African Trypanosomiasis from the crowd.
ny:
Lamlungu pa 16 October,2022, chifukwa cha masewera athu otsiriza ku Rumphi tinapita kumudzi wa Bowe, komwe tinalandiridwa bwino ndi anthu a m'mudzimo. 
Aphunzitsi a m'mudzi uliwonse wa m'deralo anali ofunika kwambiri kutithandiza kufunsa omvera mafunso okhudza zochitikazo, zomwe zidzakhala zofunika pakufufuza kwathu. Panali masewera akuluakulu a mpira pakati pa Bowe vs Betere ndipo magulu a netball am'deralo adasewera bwino kwambiri.
Izi, pokhala ntchito yathu yomaliza ku Rumphi, zinali zopambana kwambiri ndipo tinali ndi mafunso ambiri abwino okhudza African Trypanosomiasis kuchokera pagulu.

en: Introduction
ny: Mau oyamba

en: Fellow Malawians, it is with great conviction and patriotism for my country, that I have decided to speak on issues that are affecting us all. I say conviction and patriotism for my country because in taking this stand, I am well aware of the associated risks to me personally, my family and my colleagues. However, my personal comfort plays subordinate to the national good. It is on that basis that I have braved to make this statement.
ny: A Malawi anzanga, ndi chikhulupiriro chachikulu komanso kukonda dziko langa, ndaganiza zolankhula pa nkhani zomwe zikutikhudza tonsefe. Ndikunena chikhulupiriro ndi kukonda dziko langa chifukwa potengera kaimidwe kameneka, ndikudziwa bwino za zoopsa zogwirizana ndi ine ndekha, banja langa ndi anzanga. Komabe, chitonthozo changa chaumwini chimasewera pansi pa ubwino wa dziko. Ndi pa maziko amenewo amene ndalimba mtima kunena mawu amenewa.

en: I am inspired by the many brave Malawians who have come before me. From the time of Reverend John Chilembwe to Dr. Kamuzu Banda, who fought against a white establishment for us to attain political independence. I am inspired by the likes of Dr. Bakili Muluzi, late Chakufwa Chihana, late Aleke Banda and all those who braved the one-party system in the early 1990s for us to have democracy. These Malawians knew the risks so well but put the interest of the nation far ahead of their personal interests. If it were not for their sacrifices, perhaps we would until today be under colonial rule or under one-party system. This statement I am making is a fruit of their sacrifices. I am personally indebted to them all.
ny: Ndikuuziridwa ndi a Malawi ambiri olimba mtima omwe abwera pamaso panga. Kuyambira nthawi ya Reverend John Chilembwe mpaka Dr. Kamuzu Banda, yemwe anamenyana ndi gulu la azungu kuti tipeze ufulu wandale. Ndikuuziridwa ndi anthu ngati Dr. Bakili Muluzi, malemu Chakufwa Chihana, malemu Aleke Banda ndi onse amene analimba mtima dongosolo la chipani chimodzi kumayambiriro kwa zaka za m'ma 1990 kuti tikhale ndi demokalase. A Malawi amenewa ankadziwa bwino kwambiri zoopsa koma anaika chidwi cha mtundu patsogolo kwambiri pa zofuna zawo. Zikanakhala kuti si nsembe zawo, mwinamwake mpaka lero tikadakhala pansi pa ulamuliro wa atsamunda kapena pansi pa dongosolo la chipani chimodzi. Mawu amenewa ndikupanga ndi chipatso cha nsembe zawo. Ineyo pandekha ndili ndi ngongole kwa onse.

en: Malawi is a country well-endowed with natural resources and a predominantly youthful and energetic human resource which unfortunately is currently under- utilized. Malawi has everything required for her people to economically develop except it lacks effective leadership. Our development challenges have remained the same. Economic growth rate remains low, children still learn under a tree, health facilities are poorly resourced, some people have yet to have access to safe drinking water, agriculture is largely rain-fed and subsistence, markets for agricultural produce are weak and unpredictable, few people own houses in urban areas and only few houses in rural areas are permanent, transport system is inefficient and expensive, university students from low income households continue to face the risk of withdrawal on account of lack of tuition fee or upkeep expenses, small and medium enterprises cannot grow because the business environment is less conducive and some districts have yet to have tarmac road until now.
ny: Malawi ndi dziko lopatsidwa bwino chuma chachilengedwe komanso chuma cha anthu ambiri achinyamata komanso amphamvu chomwe mwatsoka panopa chimagwiritsidwa ntchito moperewera. Malawi ali ndi zonse zofunikira kuti anthu ake atukuke m'zachuma kupatula kuti alibe utsogoleri wogwira mtima. Mavuto athu a chitukuko akhalabe ofanana. Chiwerengero cha kukula kwa chuma chidakali chochepa, ana amaphunzirabe pansi pa mtengo, malo azaumoyo alibe chuma, anthu ena adakalibe kupeza madzi akumwa abwino, ulimi kwakukulukulu umadyetsedwa ndi mvula ndipo chakudya, misika ya zokolola zaulimi ndi yofooka komanso yosadziwika, anthu ochepa ali ndi nyumba m'matauni ndipo nyumba zochepa zokha m'madera akumidzi ndizokhazikika,  kayendedwe ka kayendedwe ndi kosagwira ntchito bwino komanso kokwera mtengo, ophunzira akuyunivesite ochokera m'mabanja osauka akupitilizabe kuyang'anizana ndi chiopsezo chochoka chifukwa cha kusowa kwa ndalama zolipirira maphunziro kapena ndalama zosamalira, mabizinesi ang'onoang'ono ndi apakati sangathe kukula chifukwa malo ogulitsa malonda ndi ochepa ndipo zigawo zina sizinakhalebe ndi msewu wa tarmac mpaka pano.

en: In fact, if one reads the priorities in the 1965 Nyasaland Development Plan and compare with priorities in the Statement of Development Policies in 1970s to mid- 1990s, then read Vision 2020 and then read Malawi 2063, it is clear that our priorities have remained the same. The reason they have remained the same is because they remain challenges because we have not made noticeable improvement as a country. The reason they remain challenges is because no leadership has addressed any key priority exhaustively. We still discuss food insecurity. We still discuss poor access to safe drinking water. We still discuss lack of all-weather roads in some areas. We still discuss poor access to electricity. We still discuss lack of profitable markets for farmers. We still discuss high unemployment especially among the youth.
ny: Ndipotu, ngati wina awerenga zofunika kwambiri mu 1965 Nyasaland Development Plan ndikuyerekeza ndi zofunika kwambiri mu Statement of Development Policies m'zaka za m'ma 1970 mpaka pakati pa zaka za m'ma 1990, kenako werengani Vision 2020 kenako n'kuwerenga Malawi 2063, zikuonekeratu kuti zinthu zathu zofunika kwambiri zakhala zomwezo. Chifukwa chomwe akhalira chimodzimodzi ndi chifukwa chakuti amakhalabe ndi mavuto chifukwa sitinapange kusintha kowoneka bwino monga dziko. Chifukwa chomwe amakhalabe ndi mavuto ndi chifukwa chakuti palibe utsogoleri umene wathana ndi chinthu chilichonse chofunika kwambiri mokwanira. Tikukambiranabe za kusowa kwa chakudya. Tikukambiranabe za kusowa kwa madzi akumwa abwino. Tikukambiranabe za kusowa kwa misewu yonse ya nyengo m'madera ena. Tikukambiranabe za kusowa kwa magetsi. Tikukambiranabe za kusowa kwa misika yopindulitsa kwa alimi. Tikukambiranabe za ulova waukulu makamaka pakati pa achinyamata.

en: Economy
ny: Economy

en: Fellow Malawians, our economy remains small, vulnerable to shocks and we continue carrying the Least Developed Country label. Even more irritating is that countries which have been at war or in conflict have economies stronger than ours. The weak economy we have is not the make of nature. It is the make of our leaders. While acknowledging periods of progress, such periods have been episodic and short-lived.
ny: A Malawi anzathu, chuma chathu chimakhalabe chaching'ono, chovuta ku mantha ndipo tikupitiriza kunyamula chizindikiro cha Least Developed Country. Chokwiyitsa kwambiri nchakuti maiko amene akhala pa nkhondo kapena m'nkhondo ali ndi chuma champhamvu kuposa chathu. Chuma chofooka chimene tili nacho sichiri kupanga chilengedwe. Ndi kupanga kwa atsogoleri athu. Ngakhale kuvomereza nthawi za kupita patsogolo, nthawi zoterezi zakhala episodic ndi zosakhalitsa.

en: Malawi has capacity to feed itself and other countries given its abundant water resources for irrigation. Malawi has capacity to substitute imports and to increase exports and in so doing improve her balance of payments, stabilize exchange rate and contain inflation rate. Malawi has capacity to manage its own budget without heavy borrowing.
ny: Malawi ili ndi mphamvu yodzidyetsa yokha ndipo maiko ena apatsidwa madzi ake ochuluka a ulimi wothirira. Dziko la Malawi lili ndi mphamvu zolowetsa m'malo mwake komanso kuwonjezera katundu wogulitsa kunja ndipo pochita zimenezi limawongolera malipiro ake, kukhazikitsa mtengo wosinthanitsa komanso kukhala ndi mitengo ya zinthu. Malawi ali ndi mphamvu zoyendetsera budget yake popanda kubwereka ndalama zambiri.

en: Sadly, people we have put in position of power to advance our common interests have opted to pursue personal interests, maintain luxuries and perpetuate the status quo at the expense of common Malawians whom they are meant to serve. There is both outright impunity and institutionalized impunity. An example of institutionalized impunity is the heaping of allowance entitlements to cabinet members and senior government officers when middle and junior level officers continue earning low salaries.
ny: N'zomvetsa chisoni kuti anthu amene tawaika pa udindo wopititsa patsogolo zofuna zathu zonse asankha kuchita zinthu zaumwini, kusunga zinthu zapamwamba komanso kupitiriza mkhalidwe umene ulipo powononga anthu wamba a ku Malawi amene akuyenera kuwatumikira. Pali ponse paŵiri kupanda chilango kotheratu ndi kupanda chilango kwa mabungwe. Chitsanzo cha kupanda chilango kokhazikitsidwa ndicho kuunjika ufulu wa chilolezo kwa mamembala a nduna ndi akuluakulu a boma pamene akuluakulu a boma akupitirizabe kupeza malipiro ochepa.

en: We have a system which just fuel allowance entitlement of a cabinet member is worth more than a salary of a Principal Secretary and fuel allowance entitlement of a Principal Secretary is worth more than a salary of a middle level officer. The same is the case in state owned enterprises.
ny: Tili ndi dongosolo lomwe kungoyambitsa ufulu wa fuel allowance wa membala wa nduna ndi ofunika kuposa malipiro a Principal Secretary ndipo ufulu wa fuel allowance wa Principal Secretary ndi wamtengo wapatali kuposa malipiro a mkulu wapakati. N'chimodzimodzinso ndi makampani a boma.

en: I stand with you; teachers, police officers, healthcare workers, agriculture extension workers and many others whose salary is a fraction of just one allowance entitlement of a senior public officer and a minister. Surely, this is institutionalized impunity and must stop.
ny: Ndikuima nanu; aphunzitsi, apolisi, ogwira ntchito zaumoyo, ogwira ntchito yowonjezera ulimi ndi ena ambiri omwe malipiro awo ndi gawo limodzi lokha la ufulu wa chilolezo cha mkulu wa boma ndi nduna. Ndithudi, ichi chiri chilango chokhazikitsidwa ndipo chiyenera kutha.

en: I stand with you parents whose children are learning under a tree. I stand with you families who are struggling to put food on the table. I stand with you families whose sick relatives are sent back from hospital without receiving treatment. I stand with you, university students, who are struggling to meet upkeep expenses. I stand with you who are looking for a job which you are not able to find. I stand with you farmers who have been at subsistence level without hope of growing to a higher level. Your next government will stand with you. It will be a government whose job is to offer solutions and will address the challenges you are facing. You can count on me.
ny: Ndikuima nanu makolo amene ana awo akuphunzira pansi pa mtengo. Ndikuima nanu mabanja omwe akuvutika kuika chakudya patebulo. Ndikuima nanu mabanja amene achibale awo odwala amabwezeretsedwa kuchipatala popanda kulandira chithandizo. Ndikuima nanu, ophunzira akuyunivesite, omwe akuvutika kuti akwaniritse ndalama zosamalira. Ndikuima nanu amene mukufunafuna ntchito yomwe simungathe kupeza. Ndikuima nanu alimi omwe akhala pamlingo wa moyo popanda chiyembekezo cha kukula mpaka pamwamba. Boma lanu lotsatira lidzaima nanu. Idzakhala boma lomwe ntchito yake ndi kupereka njira zothetsera vutoli ndipo lidzathetsa mavuto omwe mukukumana nawo. Mukhoza kudalira ine.

en: Fellow Malawians, I believe in the potential of our country and in Malawians. We read positive stories about economic success of Rwanda. Zambia has just changed narrative since their current government came in office later than our current government and we are hearing positive stories. There is no reason other than poor leadership, that stories for Malawi that make international news headlines are poverty, hunger and corruption involving high profile public officers.
ny: A Malawi anzanga, ndimakhulupilira kuthekera kwa dziko lathu komanso ku Malawi. Timawerenga nkhani zabwino zokhudza kupambana kwa chuma cha Rwanda. Zambia yangosintha nkhani kuyambira pamene boma lawo lomwe lilipoli linabwera paudindo pambuyo pake kuposa boma lathu lomwe lilipo ndipo tikumva nkhani zabwino. Palibe chifukwa china kupatula utsogoleri woipa, kuti nkhani za Malawi zomwe zimapanga mitu ya nkhani padziko lonse ndi umphawi, njala ndi ziphuphu zokhudzana ndi akuluakulu a boma.

en: I feel the pain we are all going through in the tough economic times. I acknowledge that part of the reasons for the economic challenges are external factors such as a war in Ukraine and tropical cyclones. However, as I have said time and again in various media interviews, the external factors have just contributed. A large part of the challenges is our own making. The past national budgets by the current political administration were poorly prepared, not transformative and did not build foundation for macroeconomic stability. I said it in 2020 and have consistently said this. The problems we are going through were anticipated and I did not keep quiet, I shared my views then.
ny: Ndikumva kupweteka kumene tonse tikukumana nawo m'nthaŵi zovuta zachuma. Ndikuvomereza kuti mbali ya zifukwa zomwe zimayambitsa mavuto azachuma ndi zinthu zakunja monga nkhondo ku Ukraine ndi mphepo yamkuntho. Komabe, monga ndanenera nthawi ndi nthawi mu zokambirana zosiyanasiyana zofalitsa nkhani, zinthu zakunja zangothandizira. Mbali yaikulu ya zovuta ndizo kupanga kwathu. Mabajeti akale a dziko lonse ndi boma la ndale lamakono sanakonzekere bwino, osati kusintha ndipo sanamange maziko a kukhazikika kwa macroeconomic. Ndanena izo mu 2020 ndipo ndakhala ndikunena izi nthawi zonse. Mavuto omwe tikukumana nawo anayembekezeredwa ndipo sindinali chete, ndinagawana malingaliro anga pamenepo.

en: The fast-rising public debt is testimony of lack of fiscal discipline. We were reminded a month ago that every Malawian is carrying on our shoulders a debt burden of K600,000. Unfortunately, this is not debt that financed programs to improve the living standard of us all. This is debt that financed corruption and luxury of senior officers. There has been limited interest to reform the fiscal plan – to remove or reduce unnecessary expenditure items and to grow the revenue base by increasing resource allocation to productive sectors. Additionally, there has been high level inefficiency in government resulting in delays to approve projects. The State President himself and some ministers have admitted this in public. Delay to approve projects locks up foreign exchange since most projects are donor- funded, delays job opportunities and delays development outcomes. These are the main reasons we are going through difficult times. If the leadership was up to task, the extent of suffering would be less than is the case.
ny: Ngongole ya boma yomwe ikukwera mofulumira ndi umboni wa kusowa kwa chilango cha zachuma. Tinakumbutsidwa mwezi wapitawo kuti Mmalawi aliyense akunyamula pamapewa athu ngongole ya K600,000. Tsoka ilo, iyi si ngongole yomwe inachitira ndalama mapulogalamu kuti tiwongolere moyo wa tonsefe. Iyi ndi ngongole yomwe ina ndalama za ziphuphu ndi zapamwamba za akuluakulu akuluakulu. Pakhala chidwi chochepa chosintha dongosolo la zachuma - kuchotsa kapena kuchepetsa zinthu zowonongeka zosafunikira komanso kukulitsa maziko a ndalama powonjezera kugawidwa kwa chuma ku zigawo zokolola. Kuphatikiza apo, pakhala kusagwira bwino ntchito kwapamwamba m'boma zomwe zachititsa kuchedwa kuvomereza ntchito. Pulezidenti wa Boma mwiniwakeyo ndi nduna zina avomereza zimenezi pagulu. Kuchedwa kuvomereza ntchito kumatseka ndalama zakunja popeza ntchito zambiri zimaperekedwa ndi wopereka- ndalama, zimachedwetsa mwayi wa ntchito ndikuchedwetsa zotsatira za chitukuko. Izi ndi zifukwa zazikulu zomwe tikukumana nazo panthawi yovuta. Ngati utsogoleri unali mpaka ntchito, kukula kwa kuvutika kukanakhala kochepa kuposa momwe zilili.

en: My colleagues and I come to offer genuine transformation. Malawi is a natural resource-rich and labour-abundant economy. Our economic policy will revolve around maximizing the potential in agriculture, mining, tourism and developing the human resource both in its own right and as catalysts for manufacturing. This will be done while progressively moving towards a knowledge economy by investing in science and technology.
ny: Ine ndi anzanga amabwera kudzapereka kusintha kwenikweni. Malawi ndi chuma chachilengedwe komanso chuma chochuluka cha antchito. Ndondomeko yathu ya zachuma idzazungulira pakuwonjezera kuthekera kwa ulimi, migodi, zokopa alendo komanso kukulitsa chuma cha anthu mwa ufulu wake komanso monga zothandizira kupanga. Izi zidzachitidwa pamene pang'onopang'ono zikupita ku chuma cha chidziwitso mwa kuika ndalama mu sayansi ndi teknoloji.

en: I will implement Malawi 2063 in its entirety. I am happy to inform you, fellow Malawians, that Malawi 2063 is a document I intimately subscribe to, because I was one of the reviewers. I also co-reviewed the enabler on enhanced public sector performance in the Malawi 2063 first 10 years Implementation Plan. My being identified as a person who could review this enabler is testimony that I understand the public service and I know how to make it perform. When I say I will implement it fully, I know what is in the document and I have adequate passion to implement it. I emphasize I because the responsibility for implementing a strategic plan in any organization is vested in the head of the organization. What makes a strategy work for one organization and fail for the other organization, is the quality of leadership of the organization. I will provide quality leadership.
ny: Ndidzagwiritsa ntchito Malawi 2063 yonse. Ndine wokondwa kukudziwitsani, a Malawi anzanga, kuti Malawi 2063 ndi chikalata chomwe ndimalembetsa mwathithithi, chifukwa ndinali mmodzi mwa owerengera. Inenso co-kuwunikira enabler pa patsogolo boma gawo ntchito mu Malawi 2063 woyamba 10 zaka Kukhazikitsa Plan. Kudziwika kwanga ngati munthu yemwe angathe kubwereza enabler iyi ndi umboni wakuti ndikumvetsetsa ntchito ya anthu ndipo ndikudziwa momwe ndingapangire kuti ichite. Pamene ndikunena kuti ndidzagwiritsa ntchito mokwanira, ndikudziwa zomwe zili mu chikalatacho ndipo ndili ndi chilakolako chokwanira kuti ndizigwiritsa ntchito. Ndikugogomezera ine chifukwa udindo wogwiritsa ntchito ndondomeko ya njira mu bungwe lililonse umaperekedwa kwa mutu wa bungwe. Chomwe chimapangitsa njira kugwira ntchito kwa bungwe limodzi ndikulephera bungwe lina, ndi khalidwe la utsogoleri wa bungwe. Ndidzapereka utsogoleri wabwino.

en: We will transform agriculture through Mega farms and cooperatives which will facilitate mechanization, improve productivity, promote access to reliable markets for farmers, catalyze industrialization and urbanization. We will embark on infrastructure revolution agenda. From electricity generation, transport and ICT to residential and government office buildings.
ny: Tidzasintha ulimi kudzera m'mafamu a Mega ndi mabungwe omwe angathandize makina, kuwongolera zokolola, kulimbikitsa kupeza misika yodalirika kwa alimi, kuyambitsa mafakitale ndi mizinda. Tidzayamba ndondomeko yosintha zomangamanga. Kuchokera ku kupanga magetsi, mayendedwe ndi ICT kupita ku nyumba zogona ndi maofesi a boma.

en: We will decisively support micro, small and medium enterprises. We will identify those which Malawi has comparative and competitive advantage to produce and have niche markets in the region and prioritize support to them. One key performance indicator for the Ministry of Industrialization and Trade will be the number of micro-scale enterprises graduating into small-scale; the number of small-scale enterprises graduating into medium-scale; the number of medium-scale graduating into large-scale annually. We will encourage and support Malawian large-scale enterprises to become multinational corporations. We denounce the glorification of the MSME concept as if that is the ideal destiny for them. They will be helped to grow.
ny: Tidzathandiza motsimikiza mabizinesi ang'onoang'ono, ang'onoang'ono ndi apakati. Tidzazindikira omwe Malawi ali ndi mwayi woyerekeza komanso mpikisano wotulutsa ndikukhala ndi misika ya niche m'deralo ndikuyika patsogolo thandizo kwa iwo. Chizindikiro chimodzi chofunikira cha ntchito ya Unduna wa Industrialization ndi Trade chidzakhala chiwerengero cha mabizinesi ang'onoang'ono omwe amamaliza maphunziro ang'onoang'ono; chiwerengero cha mabizinesi ang'onoang'ono omwe amamaliza maphunziro mu sing'anga; chiwerengero cha omaliza maphunziro apakati kukhala akuluakulu pachaka. Tidzalimbikitsa ndi kuthandiza makampani akuluakulu a ku Malawi kuti akhale makampani amitundu yambiri. Timatsutsa ulemerero wa lingaliro la MSME ngati kuti ndilo cholinga chabwino kwa iwo. Adzathandizidwa kukula.

en: There are four main ways in which a country can benefit from its extractive resources which include mining. These are i) royalties, ii) resource rent iii) State participation and iv) taxes. So far, the component of State participation has not been exploited despite being the most beneficial way. To maximize benefits from mining, government will establish a Mining Company that will be getting into Joint Venture arrangement with foreign companies. Joint Venture arrangements will enable Malawians to be in management team and in the Board of Directors, thereby directly participating in running mining business and curb transfer pricing and other forms of illicit financial flows that often happen in mining industry. Your next government will review tax incentives to ensure Malawians get a fair share of their natural resources.
ny: Pali njira zinayi zazikulu zomwe dziko lingapindule ndi chuma chake chotulutsa chomwe chimaphatikizapo migodi. Awa ndi i) ndalama zachifumu, ii) resource rent iii) Kutenga nawo mbali kwa boma ndi iv) misonkho. Pakadali pano, gawo la kutenga nawo mbali kwa Boma silinagwiritsidwe ntchito ngakhale kuti ndi njira yopindulitsa kwambiri. Kuti muwonjezere phindu kuchokera ku migodi, boma lidzakhazikitsa Kampani ya Migodi yomwe idzakhala ikulowera mu makonzedwe a Joint Venture ndi makampani akunja. Makonzedwe a Joint Venture adzathandiza a Malawi kukhala m'gulu loyang'anira komanso ku Board of Directors, potero kutenga nawo mbali mwachindunji kuyendetsa bizinesi ya migodi ndikuchepetsa mitengo yotumizira ndi mitundu ina ya ndalama zosavomerezeka zomwe nthawi zambiri zimachitika mu makampani a migodi. Boma lanu lotsatira lidzapenda zolimbikitsa msonkho kuonetsetsa kuti a Malawi apeza gawo labwino la chuma chawo chachilengedwe.

en: We will approach tourism holistically and contextually. Tourism is about attraction. We will invest in areas that are unique to Malawi, one of them is establishing vibrant cultural centers and packaging our history into a commercial product. Tourism is a beneficiary of derived demand. Our resolve to develop the economy, develop manufacturing sector will positively contribute to the travel and tourism industry. We will make Malawi a destination for citizens of neighboring countries to come and shop. As they come, they will need accommodation and transport just as Malawians do when they travel outside.
ny: Tidzayandikira zokopa alendo holistically ndi contextually. Zokopa alendo ndi zokopa. Tidzaika ndalama m'madera omwe ali apadera ku Malawi, imodzi mwa iwo ndikukhazikitsa malo amphamvu a chikhalidwe ndikuyika mbiri yathu kukhala malonda. Zokopa alendo zimapindula ndi kufunika kochokera. Kutsimikiza kwathu kukulitsa chuma, kukulitsa gawo lopanga kudzathandizira bwino makampani oyenda ndi zokopa alendo. Tidzapanga Malawi kukhala malo oti nzika za mayiko oyandikana nawo zibwere kudzagula. Pamene akubwera, adzafunikira malo ogona ndi mayendedwe monga momwe a Malawi amachitira akamayenda panja.

en: Agriculture transformation, infrastructure revolution, growing of MSMEs, mining, industrialization (manufacturing) and tourism will anchor our job creation agenda.
ny: Kusintha kwa ulimi, kusintha kwa zomangamanga, kukula kwa MSMEs, migodi, mafakitale (kupanga) ndi zokopa alendo kudzamangirira ndondomeko yathu yopanga ntchito.

en: My fellow Malawians, I am aware of the key drivers of cost of living. We will overhaul the fuel procurement system in the short-term while investing in cost- effective mode of transport such as rail and pipeline in line with the Malawi National Transport Master Plan. We will review all levies and remove or reduce those that can be done so without compromising public service delivery. We will work to achieve macroeconomic stability with a stable and relatively strong currency to contain imported inflation. In line with Malawi 2063, we will enhance agricultural productivity so that price of food is cheap while farmers still make profit.
ny: A Malawi anzanga, ndikudziwa zoyendetsa zazikulu za mtengo wa moyo. Tidzakonzanso dongosolo logula mafuta m'kanthawi kochepa pamene tikuyika ndalama m'njira yoyendera ndalama monga njanji ndi mapaipi mogwirizana ndi Malawi National Transport Master Plan. Tidzapenda ma levies onse ndikuchotsa kapena kuchepetsa zomwe zingatheke popanda kusokoneza ntchito yopereka ntchito ya boma. Tidzagwira ntchito kuti tikwaniritse kukhazikika kwa macroeconomic ndi ndalama zokhazikika komanso zamphamvu kuti zikhale ndi kukwera kwa mitengo kunja. Mogwirizana ndi Malawi 2063, tidzakulitsa zokolola zaulimi kuti mtengo wa chakudya ukhale wotsika mtengo pamene alimi akupezabe phindu.

en: We will embark on an ambitious home ownership program in which Malawi Housing Corporation will be recapitalized so it can build houses of different designs to suit your affordability. You will be paying monthly rental fee but which will be going towards purchase of the house. We will make home ownership easy for everyone. A well-thought housing scheme will be implemented in rural areas.
ny: Tidzayamba pulogalamu yofunitsitsa kukhala ndi nyumba yomwe bungwe la Malawi Housing Corporation lidzagwidwanso kuti lithe kumanga nyumba za mapangidwe osiyanasiyana kuti zigwirizane ndi kugula kwanu. Mudzakhala mukulipira ndalama zobwereka pamwezi koma zomwe zidzakhala zikupita kukagula nyumbayo. Tidzapangitsa kukhala ndi nyumba kukhala kosavuta kwa aliyense. Ndondomeko ya nyumba yoganizira bwino idzagwiritsidwa ntchito m'madera akumidzi.

en: My fellow Malawians, our approach to improving living standards focuses on containing cost of living on one hand and improving incomes on the other hand while investing in physical and human capital development to put a solid foundation for economic development. That is what your next government will do.
ny: A Malawi anzanga, njira yathu yopititsa patsogolo miyezo ya moyo imayang'ana pa kukhala ndi mtengo wa moyo kumbali imodzi ndikuwongolera ndalama kumbali ina pamene tikuyika ndalama mu chitukuko cha thupi ndi anthu kuti aike maziko olimba a chitukuko cha chuma. Ndizo zomwe boma lanu lotsatira lidzachita.

en: Public debt management will be key in getting the economy back on right track. Our resolve to decisively end corruption will free up resources and reduce the need for borrowing. Estimates based on previous government financial audits showed that 30% of the national budget is unaccounted for. When the system is fixed, we will save these funds and spend on intended projects. Our resolve to reform the fiscal plan so we remove unnecessary expenditure and we grow revenue base will reduce the need for borrowing. Reform of foreign missions will free up resources. Where we will have to borrow for legitimate reasons, these questions will guide in determining the source of borrowing; 1) will the loan help grow economy (GDP)? 2) will the loan help either grow tax revenue or reduce expenditure or both? 3) will the loan help grow exports? If the answer is NO especially to 2 and 3, no external loan will be contracted. If a loan still has to be secured, it will be domestic and using a long-term development bond.
ny: Kusamalira ngongole za boma kudzakhala kofunika kwambiri kuti chuma chiziyenda bwino. Kutsimikiza mtima kwathu kuthetsa ziphuphu motsimikiza kudzamasula chuma ndi kuchepetsa kufunika kwa kubwereka. Kuyerekezera kochokera ku kafukufuku wa zachuma wa boma wam'mbuyomu kunasonyeza kuti 30% ya bajeti ya dziko ndi yosadziwika. Dongosolo likakhazikika, tidzapulumutsa ndalama izi ndikugwiritsa ntchito ntchito zomwe akufuna. Kutsimikiza kwathu kusintha dongosolo la zachuma kotero timachotsa ndalama zosafunikira ndipo timakulitsa maziko a ndalama zidzachepetsa kufunika kwa kubwereka. Kusintha kwa maulendo akunja kudzamasula chuma. Kumene tidzayenera kubwereka pazifukwa zovomerezeka, mafunso awa adzatsogolera posankha gwero la kubwereka; 1) kodi ngongoleyo idzathandiza kukulitsa chuma (GDP)? 2) kodi ngongoleyo idzathandiza kukulitsa ndalama za msonkho kapena kuchepetsa ndalama zowonongedwa kapena zonse ziwiri? 3) kodi ngongoleyo idzathandiza kukulitsa katundu wotumiza kunja? Ngati yankho ndi NO makamaka ku 2 ndi 3, palibe ngongole yakunja yomwe idzapangidwe. Ngati ngongole iyenerabe kutetezedwa, idzakhala yanyumba ndikugwiritsa ntchito mgwirizano wachitukuko wa nthawi yayitali.

en: Reducing debt will feed into stimulating private sector development as commercial banks and other lenders will have enough liquidity to lend to private sector at competitive interest rates. Your next government will commit to clearing payment arrears as one way of capacitating private sector to operate fully, expand production and create additional jobs.
ny: Kuchepetsa ngongole kudzadyetsa kulimbikitsa chitukuko cha gawo la payekha monga mabanki amalonda ndi ena okongoza adzakhala ndi madzi okwanira kuti abwereke ku gawo la payekha pa chiwongoladzanja cha mpikisano. Boma lanu lotsatira lidzadzipereka kuchotsa malipiro arrears monga njira imodzi capacitating gawo payekha ntchito mokwanira, kuwonjezera kupanga ndi kulenga ntchito zina.

en: Corruption
ny: Ziphuphu

en: Corruption is a developmental challenge. It is a political campaign issue. Every leader promises to end corruption during political campaign yet corruption continues to worsen. Recent revelations of corruption are evident that our leaders are not only failing to end corruption, they are in fact participating in it.
ny: Ziphuphu ndizovuta pa chitukuko. Ndi nkhani ya kampeni ya ndale. Mtsogoleri aliyense akulonjeza kuthetsa ziphuphu panthawi ya kampeni ya ndale komabe ziphuphu zikupitirizabe kuipa. Mavumbulutso aposachedwapa a ziphuphu akuwonekeratu kuti atsogoleri athu samangolephera kuthetsa ziphuphu, kwenikweni akuchita nawo.

en: A large part of our poverty is due to corruption. We have had leaders who amass wealth for themselves through corruption and morally questionable entitlements and give us leftovers. Citizens have systematically been economically disempowered so we can depend on them. They use the same corruptly acquired wealth, stolen from the many taxes we pay, to coax us to side with them when they are caught on the wrong side of the law. They project a picture that any criminal investigation in their dealings is the work of their political rivals. We fight on their behalf even when they were the first to kill us through denying us access to education, healthcare, food and job and business opportunities.
ny: Mbali yaikulu ya umphawi wathu ndi chifukwa cha ziphuphu. Takhala ndi atsogoleri omwe amadziunjikira chuma kudzera mu ziphuphu ndi ufulu wokayikitsa mwamakhalidwe ndikutipatsa zotsalira. Nzika zakhala zikuchotsedwa mwadongosolo m'zachuma kotero kuti titha kudalira pa izo. Iwo amagwiritsira ntchito chuma chopezedwa mwachinyengo chimodzimodzicho, chobedwa ku misonkho yambiri imene timapereka, kutinyengerera kukhala kumbali yake pamene agwidwa kumbali yolakwika ya lamulo. Amapanga chithunzi chakuti kufufuza kulikonse kwa upandu m'zochita zawo ndiko ntchito ya otsutsana nawo pandale. Timalimbana m'malo mwawo ngakhale pamene iwo anali oyamba kutipha kudzera kutikaniza kupeza maphunziro, zaumoyo, chakudya ndi ntchito ndi mwayi wa bizinesi.

en: Malawi has enough financial resources to deliver public services adequately. Publicly available information confirm that it is possible to run a government without heavy borrowing. For example, it is alleged that in one contract, a business person charged government US$10,524,000 for goods that cost the business person US$2,165,700 making abnormal profit of US$8,358,300. Surely this is over- pricing and stealing from poor Malawians.
ny: Malawi ili ndi ndalama zokwanira zoperekera ntchito za boma mokwanira. Chidziwitso chopezeka pagulu chimatsimikizira kuti n'zotheka kuyendetsa boma popanda kubwereka ndalama zambiri. Mwachitsanzo, akuti m'pangano lina, munthu wina wamalonda analipira boma ndalama zokwana US$10,524,000 pa katundu amene amawononga ndalama zokwana US$2,165,700 za US$8,358,300. Ndithudi izi ndi over- pricing ndi kuba kwa a Malawi osauka.

en:
Fellow Malawians, we all can see that the main problem in Malawi is not inadequate resources but corruption and excessive and expensive entitlements of senior public officers. Fighting corruption must be a top priority for a government. That is not the case unfortunately. Some of the reasons corruption is not ending include the expensive type of political campaign and the parasitic political party system. Statistics confirm that Malawi is a least developed country hence it is a country whose people are poor and by extension, a country whose politicians are poor. The type of political campaign that is practiced is expensive and breeds a fertile ground for advance State capture by those who bankroll the campaign. Corrupt business
people finance greedy politicians in anticipation of easy access to business contracts once the politician or political party is in power. This is what has sustained State capture.
ny:
A Malawi anzathu, tonse tikhoza kuona kuti vuto lalikulu ku Malawi si chuma chosakwanira koma ziphuphu komanso ufulu wopambanitsa komanso wokwera mtengo wa akuluakulu a boma. Kulimbana ndi ziphuphu kuyenera kukhala chinthu chofunika kwambiri kwa boma. Zimenezo sizili choncho mwatsoka. Zina mwa zifukwa zomwe ziphuphu sizikutha zikuphatikizapo mtundu wokwera mtengo wa kampeni ya ndale ndi dongosolo la chipani cha ndale za parasitic. Ziwerengero zimatsimikizira kuti dziko la Malawi ndi dziko lotukuka pang'ono chifukwa chake ndi dziko lomwe anthu ake ndi osauka komanso mwa kuwonjezera, dziko lomwe andale ake ndi osauka. Mtundu wa ndawala ya ndale zadziko imene imachitidwa ngwokwera mtengo ndipo umabala nthaka yachonde ya kugwidwa pasadakhale kwa Boma ndi awo amene amagwiritsa ntchito ndawalayo. Bizinesi yowonongeka
anthu amapezera ndalama andale aumbombo poyembekezera kupeza mosavuta mapangano a zamalonda pamene wandale kapena chipani cha ndale chili mu ulamuliro. Izi ndi zomwe zachirikiza kugwidwa kwa Boma.

en: In State capture, the loser is the citizenry. Politicians influence award of government contracts to corrupt business people at inflated prices. The inflated prices are because the corrupt business people want to i) recover the money they spent to bankroll campaign, ii) sell the goods and services at a profit and iii) give part of the payment to the politicians so they remain connected. When the politicians get part of the payment they use part of the money for their personal projects and part of it for campaign materials and other political expenses. That is why the fight against corruption cannot be won if we continue using the same political campaign model. In fact, there are politicians who have established businesses out of money acquired in this way. Their businesses get contracts from the same government they stole capital from. In other words, our tax money has become business capital for greedy politicians and the businesses get contracts from government where they are paid by our tax money again. This is the height of impunity in Malawi. We all have a responsibility to stop this.
ny: Mu kugwidwa kwa Boma, wolephera ndi nzika. Andale amasonkhezera kupereka mapangano a boma kwa anthu amalonda achinyengo pamtengo wokwera. Mitengo yowonjezera ndi chifukwa chakuti anthu amalonda achinyengo akufuna i) kubwezeretsa ndalama zomwe adagwiritsa ntchito ku bankroll campaign, ii) kugulitsa katundu ndi ntchito pa phindu ndi iii) kupereka gawo la malipiro kwa andale kuti akhalebe ogwirizana. Andale akapeza gawo la malipiro amagwiritsa ntchito gawo la ndalama pa ntchito zawo zaumwini ndi gawo lake la zipangizo za kampeni ndi ndalama zina zandale. Ndicho chifukwa chake kulimbana ndi ziphuphu sikungapambane ngati tipitiriza kugwiritsa ntchito chitsanzo chomwecho cha kampeni ya ndale. Ndipotu, pali andale omwe akhazikitsa mabizinesi kuchokera ku ndalama zomwe apeza mwanjira imeneyi. Mabizinesi awo amapeza ma contract kuchokera ku boma lomwelo lomwe anaba capital ku. Mwa kuyankhula kwina, ndalama zathu za msonkho zakhala ndalama zamalonda kwa andale aumbombo ndipo mabizinesi amapeza mapangano kuchokera ku boma komwe amaperekedwa ndi ndalama zathu za msonkho kachiwiri. Uku ndiko kukwera kwa kupanda chilango ku Malawi. Tonsefe tili ndi udindo woletsa zimenezi.

en: My fellow Malawians, let me illustrate how corruption causes poverty. Suppose there was money enough to construct three school blocks but due to corruption the price is inflated and the money can only construct two school blocks. Suppose each school block has two classrooms that can accommodate 60 learners. Further, suppose constructing a school block offers job opportunity to ten people as bricklayers, carpenters and others. By constructing two instead of three school blocks because of inflated prices, the results are as follows
ny: A Malawi anzanga, ndiloleni ndifotokoze momwe ziphuphu zimayambitsera umphawi. Tiyerekeze kuti panali ndalama zokwanira kumanga nyumba zitatu za sukulu koma chifukwa cha ziphuphu mtengo wake wakwezedwa ndipo ndalamazo zingamange nyumba ziwiri zokha za sukulu. Tiyerekeze kuti chipika chilichonse cha sukulu chili ndi makalasi awiri omwe angakhale ndi ophunzira 60. Ndiponso, tiyerekeze kuti kumanga nyumba ya sukulu kumapereka mwaŵi wa ntchito kwa anthu khumi monga omanga njerwa, akalipentala ndi ena. Mwa kumanga nyumba ziwiri m'malo mwa nyumba zitatu za sukulu chifukwa cha mitengo yokwera, zotsatira zake zili motere

en: Three blocks would have made 360 learners move from learning under a tree to a proper classroom, but due to corruption only 240 learners will be in a good classroom. The other 120 learners will continue learning under a tree yet money was available to put them in a good classroom.
ny: Mipiringidzo itatu ikanapangitsa ophunzira 360 kuchoka pa kuphunzira pansi pa mtengo kupita ku kalasi yoyenera, koma chifukwa cha ziphuphu ophunzira 240 okha adzakhala m'kalasi labwino. Ophunzira ena 120 adzapitiriza kuphunzira pansi pa mtengo komabe ndalama zinalipo kuti ziike m'kalasi labwino.

en: Constructing three school blocks would create employment opportunities to 30 people. By constructing two, it means 10 people who would have some work to do still have no job.
ny: Kumanga nyumba zitatu za sukulu kungapangitse mwayi wa ntchito kwa anthu 30. Mwa kumanga awiri, zikutanthauza kuti anthu 10 omwe angakhale ndi ntchito yoti agwire adakalibe ntchito.

en: Since there is corruption, there is high likelihood that the two school blocks may be of substandard quality. They may need maintenance quicker than if construction was not marred with corruption. Additional resources are likely to be spent to rehabilitate the same school blocks when the resources would have been spent on other functions.
ny: Popeza kuti pali ziphuphu, pali kuthekera kwakukulu kwakuti sukulu ziŵirizo zingakhale zosakwanira. Iwo angafunikire kukonza mofulumira kuposa ngati kumanga sikunasokonezedwe ndi ziphuphu. Ndalama zowonjezereka zikhoza kugwiritsidwa ntchito kukonzanso nyumba za sukulu zomwezo pamene chumacho chikanagwiritsidwa ntchito pa ntchito zina.

en: If children are learning under a tree; if there are no drugs in health facilities; if there are no all-weather roads in some areas; if jobs are scarce; if we Malawians are poor; one of the main causes is corruption.
ny: Ngati ana akuphunzira pansi pa mtengo; ngati palibe mankhwala m'malo azaumoyo; ngati palibe misewu yonse ya nyengo m'madera ena; ngati ntchito zikusowa; ngati ife a Malawi ndife osauka; chimodzi mwa zochititsa zazikulu ndi ziphuphu.

en: Our approach to the fight against corruption starts from the process of getting into office. We will not do the traditional political campaign you have known. We will not do because we do not want to get money from corrupt business people so that when you vote us into office we serve them instead of serving you, Malawians.
ny: Njira yathu yolimbana ndi ziphuphu imayamba kuchokera ku ndondomeko yolowa mu udindo. Sitidzachita kampeni ya ndale zachikhalidwe yomwe mwadziwa. Sitidzachita chifukwa sitikufuna kupeza ndalama kuchokera kwa anthu amalonda achinyengo kuti mukativotere pa udindo timawatumikira mmalo mokutumikirani, a Malawi.

en: We will not form a political party because it is an expensive organization that contributes to temptation of political leaders to indulge in corruption and when in office, abuse public resources to fund the political party. You can relate this to some of the revelations that are coming out now of how public institutions financed activities of a political party. We do not want to tie ourselves to the yokes that have chained the others. More importantly, not forming a political party means that there will be no group of people (members of the ruling party) that feels and behaves as more important than the rest of Malawians. Between me and the public service, there will be no person or group of people to terrorize public servants on the premise that they are the ruling party members.
ny: Sitidzapanga chipani cha ndale chifukwa ndi bungwe lamtengo wapatali lomwe limathandizira kuyesedwa kwa atsogoleri andale kuti adzipereke pa ziphuphu komanso pamene ali paudindo, kugwiritsa ntchito molakwika chuma cha boma kuti apereke ndalama ku chipani cha ndale. Mukhoza kugwirizanitsa izi ndi zina mwa mavumbulutso omwe akutuluka tsopano momwe mabungwe aboma amalipirira ntchito za chipani cha ndale. Sitikufuna kudzimangirira ku goli limene lamangirira enawo. Chofunika kwambiri, kusapanga chipani cha ndale kumatanthauza kuti sipadzakhala gulu la anthu (anthu a chipani cholamulira) omwe amaona ndi kuchita zinthu ngati zofunika kwambiri kuposa a Malawi ena onse. Pakati pa ine ndi ntchito ya boma, sipadzakhala munthu kapena gulu la anthu oopseza ogwira ntchito m'boma poganiza kuti ndi mamembala a chipani cholamulira.

en: It is not an exaggeration to say that political parties have been a disuniting factor so far in Malawi as they have been catalyst for tribalism and nepotism. You may appreciate the observation that in some political parties, it does not matter how loyal and qualified a member is, if they do not come from a particular region or from a particular tribe they cannot be voted president of a party to have a chance to contest as president of a country. We must for a moment dismantle this construct and create a political system that gives hope to every Malawian everywhere that they can be anything including President of Malawi if they work hard, have qualifications and have the integrity to serve their nation. I am convinced that being a president without a political party will foster nation building.
ny: Si kukokomeza kunena kuti zipani za ndale zakhala zikugwirizana mpaka pano ku Malawi popeza zakhala zikuchititsa tribalism ndi nepotism. Mungayamikire lingaliro lakuti m'zipani zina za ndale, ziribe kanthu kuti membala ndi wokhulupirika komanso woyenerera bwanji, ngati sakuchokera ku dera linalake kapena kuchokera ku fuko linalake sangathe kuvoteredwa kukhala pulezidenti wa chipani kuti akhale ndi mwayi wopikisana ngati pulezidenti wa dziko. We must for a moment dismantle this construct and create a political system that gives hope to every Malawian everywhere that they can be anything including President of Malawi if they work hard, have qualifications and have the integrity to serve their nation. Ndikutsimikiza kuti kukhala pulezidenti wopanda chipani cha ndale kudzalimbikitsa kumanga mtundu.

en: Additionally, as your leader, I will have all my focus on running government, rather than divide my focus between running government on one hand and running a political party on the other hand.
ny: Kuphatikiza apo, monga mtsogoleri wanu, ndidzakhala ndi maganizo anga onse pa kuyendetsa boma, m'malo mogawanitsa maganizo anga pakati pa kuyendetsa boma kumbali imodzi ndi kuyendetsa chipani cha ndale kumbali ina.

en: Fighting corruption is a war. Being a war, it needs troops who are loyal to their nation, troops who are well-trained and well-resourced. Above all, troops who are best commanded. The agencies responsible for fighting corruption are the troops. The President is the commander. Like in a military war, if troops are compromised, it is difficult to win the fight against corruption. If the commander is compromised, it is impossible to win the fight against corruption.
ny: Kulimbana ndi ziphuphu ndi nkhondo. Pokhala nkhondo, imafuna asilikali omwe ali okhulupirika kwa mtundu wawo, asilikali omwe ali ophunzitsidwa bwino komanso odziwa bwino. Koposa zonse, asilikali omwe akulamulidwa bwino kwambiri. Mabungwe omwe ali ndi udindo wolimbana ndi ziphuphu ndi asilikali. President ndi commander. Mofanana ndi nkhondo yankhondo, ngati asilikali asokonezedwa, nkovuta kupambana polimbana ndi ziphuphu. Ngati mtsogoleri wasokonezedwa, n'zosatheka kupambana pa nkhondo yolimbana ndi ziphuphu.

en: For the reason that we will not get into office through a corrupt process, you can be assured that my team and I will fight against corruption decisively for we will not be haunted by our own involvement in the same. I will take it my prime responsibility that the fight against corruption is ably commanded and that if there are elements of compromised loyalty in the troops, I take corrective measures. I can guarantee that under my stewardship, no effort will be spared to fight corruption.
ny: Chifukwa chakuti sitidzalowa mu udindo kudzera mu ndondomeko yowonongeka, mutha kutsimikiziridwa kuti gulu langa ndi ine tidzalimbana ndi ziphuphu motsimikiza chifukwa sitidzavutitsidwa ndi kukhudzidwa kwathu mu zomwezo. Ndidzatenga udindo wanga waukulu kuti kulimbana ndi ziphuphu kumalamulidwa bwino ndikuti ngati pali mbali za kukhulupirika kololera m'magulu ankhondo, ndimatenga njira zowongolera. Ndikhoza kutsimikizira kuti pansi pa uyang'aniro wanga, palibe kuyesayesa kumene kudzapulumutsidwa kulimbana ndi ziphuphu.

en: The future of Malawi leadership
ny: Tsogolo la utsogoleri wa Malawi

en: Fellow Malawians, I understand the frustration among well-meaning Malawians. I am aware that some of you have lost interest in voting in next election because we have been disappointed by the political administrations we have had. I come to give hope. I come to restore the courage we always have had, believing that as citizens, power is in our hands to make a leadership that has i) integrity, ii) technical and administrative competence and iii) desire to serve.
ny: A Malawi anzanga, ndikumvetsa kukhumudwa pakati pa a Malawi omwe ali ndi cholinga chabwino. Ndikudziwa kuti ena mwa inu mwataya chidwi chovota pa chisankho chotsatira chifukwa takhumudwa ndi maulamuliro andale omwe takhala nawo. Ndimabwera kudzapereka chiyembekezo. Ndikubwera kudzabwezeretsa kulimba mtima komwe takhala nako nthawi zonse, ndikukhulupirira kuti monga nzika, mphamvu ili m'manja mwathu kuti tipange utsogoleri womwe uli ndi i) kukhulupirika, ii) luso ndi luso loyang'anira ndi iii) chikhumbo chotumikira.

en: The 2025 presidential election will be a ‘referendum’ - a choice between maintaining impunity versus ending impunity; a choice between maintaining mediocrity versus a launch of meritocracy; a choice between politicians versus leaders.
ny: Chisankho cha pulezidenti cha 2025 chidzakhala 'referendum' - kusankha pakati pa kusunga chilango motsutsana ndi kuthetsa chilango; kusankha pakati pa kusunga mediocrity motsutsana ndi kukhazikitsidwa kwa meritocracy; kusankha pakati pa andale motsutsana ndi atsogoleri.

en: To echo the words of Barack Obama, former President of the USA, “we did not inherit the country from our ancestors so we can feel a sense of entitlement, rather we borrowed it from our children and the generations to come and therefore we have an obligation to hand over a better country to them”.
ny: Kubwereza mawu a Barack Obama, yemwe kale anali Purezidenti wa USA, "sitinalandire dziko kuchokera kwa makolo athu kuti tithe kumva lingaliro la ufulu, m'malo mwake tinabwereka kwa ana athu ndi mibadwo ikubwerayi ndipo chifukwa chake tili ndi udindo wopereka dziko labwino kwa iwo".

en: We have a responsibility to change the narrative that politics is for the few rich Malawians more so those getting rich through corruption and theft of public resources. We have a duty to change the narrative that politics is for crooks, liars, the incompetent and that politics is risky.
ny: Tili ndi udindo wosintha nkhani yoti ndale ndi za a Malawi ochepa olemera kwambiri choncho amene akulemera kudzera mu ziphuphu ndi kuba chuma cha boma. Tili ndi udindo wosintha nkhani yoti ndale ndi za ma crooks, abodza, osakhoza komanso kuti ndale ndizoopsa.

en: My colleagues and I are at your service and are determined to make personal sacrifices for the sake of presenting a real choice to you in the next elections. We come so that as voters you are not faced with a choice between lemons and grapefruits (manyumwa), for both are sour. We come to be your real choice. We know the contenders are heavily armoured with resources, including those they stole from our taxes.
ny: Ine ndi anzanga tili pa utumiki wanu ndipo tatsimikiza mtima kudzimana zinthu zaumwini chifukwa chopereka chisankho chenicheni kwa inu pa zisankho zotsatira. Timabwera kuti monga ovota musayang'anizane ndi kusankha pakati pa mandimu ndi mphesa (manyumwa), chifukwa onsewa ndi owawa. Timabwera kukhala chisankho chanu chenicheni. Ife tikudziwa kuti opikisana nawo ali ndi zida zambiri ndi chuma, kuphatikizapo omwe anaba misonkho yathu.

en: We are armoured with faith. We believe we shall succeed with your support. We are ready to govern and to do so competently. I have the right training, experience and exposure to public policy to competently develop the economy and run the public service. As you may appreciate, the duty of any government is two-fold; i) to develop the economy with the aim of improving people’s living standards and ii) to manage the public service so it can deliver public goods and services to people professionally, efficiently and effectively. I promise to deliver on these two cardinal roles in an excellent manner.
ny: Tili ndi chikhulupiriro. Tikukhulupirira kuti tidzapambana ndi thandizo lanu. Tili okonzeka kulamulira ndi kuchita zimenezo mwaluso. Ndili ndi maphunziro oyenera, chidziwitso komanso kuwonetsedwa kwa ndondomeko ya boma kuti ndikulitse bwino chuma ndikuyendetsa ntchito ya boma. Monga momwe mungayamikire, ntchito ya boma lililonse ndi iwiri; i) kukulitsa chuma ndi cholinga chowongolera moyo wa anthu ndi ii) kuyang'anira ntchito ya boma kuti athe kupereka katundu wa boma ndi ntchito kwa anthu mwaukadaulo, mwachangu komanso bwino. Ndikulonjeza kupereka maudindo awiriwa a cardinal m'njira yabwino kwambiri.

en: I appeal to you Malawians to support my candidacy. I am ready to serve you. In a special way, I encourage the youth to take 2025 election as uniquely important for I, one of their own, will be on the ballot paper. I am going to run the government in ways that will prove that the youth in Malawi are ready for the task. I will take it my additional responsibility to bring public confidence in the youth and in doing so clear a way for all youth who seek elected positions. I promise a government that will be at your service. I promise an administration that will be the moral campass of the nation.
ny: Ndikupempha inu a Malawi kuti muthandizire candidacy yanga. Ndakonzeka kukutumikirani. M'njira yapadera, ndikulimbikitsa achinyamata kuti atenge chisankho cha 2025 ngati chofunika mwapadera kwa ine, mmodzi wa iwo, ndidzakhala pa pepala la voti. Ndikuyendetsa boma m'njira zomwe zidzatsimikizire kuti achinyamata ku Malawi ali okonzeka ntchitoyi. Ndidzatenga udindo wanga wowonjezera kubweretsa chidaliro cha anthu mwa achinyamata ndipo pochita zimenezi ndikuyeretsa njira kwa achinyamata onse omwe amafunafuna maudindo osankhidwa. Ndikulonjeza boma lomwe lidzakhala pa utumiki wanu. Ndikulonjeza boma lomwe lidzakhala campass yamakhalidwe a mtundu.

en: Let us together make 2025 election a turning point for Malawi. Let us together uproot the breed of corrupt, incompetent and nepotistic politicians and plant a new breed of leaders that will be a symbol of integrity, competence and service. As late Lee Kuan Yew, founding Prime Minister of Singapore said, “we need the best and ablest in politics, not charlatans with a gift of the gab”. Let us together sanitize politics in Malawi. Politics will become clean when clean people replace the dirty ones who have made it dirty.
ny: Tiyeni limodzi tipange chisankho cha 2025 kukhala kusintha kwa Malawi. Tiyeni pamodzi tizule mtundu wa andale achinyengo, opanda luso komanso a nepotistic ndikubzala mtundu watsopano wa atsogoleri omwe adzakhala chizindikiro cha umphumphu, luso ndi utumiki. Monga mochedwa Lee Kuan Yew, woyambitsa Prime Minister wa Singapore adati, "tikufuna zabwino komanso ablest mu ndale, osati charlatans ndi mphatso ya gab". Tiyeni pamodzi sanitize ndale ku Malawi. Ndale zidzakhala zoyera pamene anthu oyera adzalowa m'malo mwa odetsedwa omwe apangitsa kuti zikhale zauve.

en: I am appealing to every Malawian to engage our conscience and think of a Malawi we would want our children and grandchildren to live in. It does not matter what our current position is, what matters is the responsibility we have to ensure we hand over a better country to our children and grandchildren. You may be a serving member of the cabinet, an advisor, a senior public officer, a political party member who genuinely believes things are not the way you would have wanted to serve the nation. I ask you to support my candidacy. Tell your family and relatives to vote for me in 2025 presidential election.
ny: Ndikupempha Mmalawi aliyense kuti agwirizane ndi chikumbumtima chathu ndikuganiza za Malawi yomwe tingafune kuti ana athu ndi adzukulu athu akhalemo. Ziribe kanthu kuti malo athu omwe tili nawo panopa ndi otani, chofunika ndi udindo womwe tili nawo kuonetsetsa kuti tikupereka dziko labwino kwa ana athu ndi adzukulu. Mukhoza kukhala membala wotumikira wa nduna, mlangizi, mkulu wa boma, membala wa chipani cha ndale yemwe amakhulupiriradi kuti zinthu si momwe mukanafunira kutumikira mtundu. Ndikukupemphani kuti muthandizire candidacy yanga. Muuzeni banja lanu ndi achibale anu kuti andivotere pa chisankho cha pulezidenti cha 2025.

en: I request you all who are in support of my candidacy to convince others around you. Convince your family members, your village mates, your village head leaders.Tell them the candidate of choice in 2025 presidential election has been identified and he is Milward Tobias. That will be your greatest contribution to my campaign.
ny: Ndikupempha inu nonse omwe mukuthandizira chisankho changa kuti mutsimikizire ena omwe akukuzungulirani. Tsimikizirani anthu a m'banja lanu, anzanu a m'mudzi mwanu, atsogoleri akuluakulu a m'mudzi mwanu. Auzeni kuti wosankhidwa wosankhidwa pa chisankho cha pulezidenti cha 2025 wadziwika ndipo ndi Milward Tobias. Chimenecho chidzakhala chithandizo chanu chachikulu kwambiri pa kampeni yanga.

en: To my colleagues; the road will be tough but we are ready for it and we will succeed. We will succeed because we are carrying the hopes of many Malawians who have been yearning for a leadership that can serve them, not one that serves a small group and corrupt business people. Malawians are looking for a leadership that has the integrity to tell the truth, to be accountable and transparent and to develop Malawi.
